intro: Piper jubimarginatum, commonly known as the golden piper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive golden margin. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are followed by small, round berries. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
